intro: Galactia grayi, commonly known as the gray's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its milky sap, which is toxic to some animals, gives it its common name. Galactia grayi typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
